definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Long ago, people who were rich or important rode horses that were very tall.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，鉅富顯要們都騎高頭大馬。

sentences.english: The brewery had 25 heavy horses delivering beer in London.
sentences.chinese: 啤酒廠有25匹高頭大馬在倫敦城中運送啤酒。

sentences.english: The stock farm is raising big horses for work in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 這個畜牧場在飼養幹農活的高頭大馬。

sentences.english: The boy had to be boosted up onto the large horse.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩必須讓人託着才能騎上那高頭大馬。

sentences.english: We were sitting in the tall horse ride.
sentences.chinese: 我們正坐加拿大高頭大馬。

definition: to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
